page.title: 04SCHOOL. SHOPS.
page.content: {SCHOOL} Smalley Richardson Endowed Primary School is its full name and it teaches children up to the age of 11 when they transfer to Heanor Gate School. The school is of red brick, was built in the nineteenth century and has a playgrond at the front. One teacher said it was the right size for the village, that it was a very friendly school with hardly any violence. Certainly we found the children were very happy at their work. There was once a separate infant school in the village but this was closed a few years ago and the building is used as a community hall. {SHOPS} There are four shops in Smalley 1) The post office and grocery shop (R Hughes). This shop is at the north end of the village.
